questions.text: What is the primary business problem you're trying to solve?

techProfile.ScaleRecommendation: Use Scikit-learn for <100k records, XGBoost/LightGBM for 100k-1M records, Distributed ML (Spark MLlib) for >1M records

effects.summary: This is a classical machine learning regression problem. Success depends heavily on feature quality and domain expertise.
avoidTech: Generative AI / LLMs for the core prediction task
Complex Deep Learning unless dealing with time-series with complex patterns
Agentic AI systems for straightforward numerical prediction

domain_expert.title: Domain Expert
domain_expert.knowledge: Business context for feature engineering and validation

techProfile.ScaleRecommendation: Logistic Regression/Random Forest for <50k records, Gradient Boosting for 50k-500k records, Deep Learning for >500k complex records

effects.summary: This is a classical machine learning classification problem. Focus on class balance and appropriate evaluation metrics.
avoidTech: Generative AI / LLMs for straightforward classification
Agentic AI for simple categorization tasks

ml_engineer.title: ML Engineer
ml_engineer.knowledge: Scikit-learn, Imbalanced Data Handling, Classification Metrics (AUC-ROC, F1, Precision-Recall)

options.label: Process and understand text (Natural Language Processing)

techProfile.ApproachGuidance: Simple tasks: Use pre-trained embeddings + classical ML. Complex tasks: Fine-tune transformer models. Document processing: Consider specialized models like LayoutLM.

effects.summary: NLP complexity varies dramatically. Start simple and escalate only when necessary.

ai_engineer.knowledge: Hugging Face Transformers, NLTK/spaCy, Embedding Models, Text preprocessing

techProfile.ApproachGuidance: Always start with transfer learning from pre-trained models (ResNet, EfficientNet, YOLO). Only train from scratch if you have >100k labeled images and unique domain requirements.

effects.summary: Computer Vision requires significant computational resources and labeled data. Transfer learning is almost always the right approach.
avoidTech: Training from scratch without massive datasets
Rule-based systems for complex image tasks

cv_engineer.title: Computer Vision Engineer
cv_engineer.knowledge: PyTorch/TensorFlow, OpenCV, Transfer Learning, Data Augmentation

techProfile.Approach: Use managed OCR services (Google Vision AI, Azure Read API, AWS Textract) unless you have highly specialized documents that require custom models.
techProfile.Key Models/Services: Cloud OCR APIs with post-processing pipeline

integration_engineer.title: Integration Engineer
integration_engineer.knowledge: API Integration, JSON/Data Structuring, Quality Control Logic, Document processing pipelines

effects.summary: OCR is a solved problem for most use cases. Focus on post-processing and quality validation rather than building custom models.
avoidTech: Building custom OCR models unless absolutely necessary

techProfile.ApproachGuidance: Simple keyword search: Elasticsearch. Semantic search: Vector embeddings + vector DB. Question answering: RAG with LLMs.

ai_engineer.title: AI Engineer
ai_engineer.knowledge: Vector Databases (Pinecone, Weaviate, Chroma), Embedding Models, LLM APIs

data_engineer.title: Data Engineer
data_engineer.knowledge: Data Ingestion Pipelines, Document Chunking, ETL for unstructured data

effects.summary: Information retrieval spans from simple search to complex RAG systems. Complexity depends on semantic understanding requirements.

techProfile.ApproachGuidance: Start with prompt engineering on existing LLMs. Consider fine-tuning only for very specific domain requirements or style needs.

ai_engineer_llm.title: AI Engineer (LLM Specialist)
ai_engineer_llm.knowledge: Prompt Engineering, LLM Fine-tuning, LLM APIs (OpenAI, Anthropic, etc.)

effects.summary: Content generation is powerful but requires careful output validation and bias monitoring.

techProfile.ApproachGuidance: Start with rule-based systems for well-defined decisions. Use ML when patterns are complex or rules are hard to define explicitly.

effects.summary: Decision support ranges from simple rule engines to complex ML models. Always implement human oversight for critical decisions.

business_analyst.title: Business Analyst
business_analyst.knowledge: Decision process mapping, Business rules documentation

effects.implementationStrategy: Implement in phases: Rule-based → ML-assisted → Automated (with human oversight)

techProfile.ApproachGuidance: Use statistical methods for simple cases, ML for complex patterns. Consider ensemble approaches for robust detection.

effects.summary: Anomaly detection is highly domain-specific. Success depends on understanding normal vs. abnormal patterns in your specific context.
avoidTech: Supervised learning if anomalies are undefined or unlabeled

ml_engineer.title: ML Engineer
ml_engineer.knowledge: Isolation Forest, LOF, Autoencoders, Statistical process control

techProfile.ApproachGuidance: Use classical optimization (linear/nonlinear programming) for well-defined problems. Consider RL for complex, dynamic environments.

effects.summary: Optimization problems require clear objective functions and constraints. Most business optimization can be solved with classical methods.

techProfile.ScaleGuidance: Pandas for <10GB, Polars for 10-100GB, Spark for >100GB or distributed processing needs

data_engineer.title: Data Engineer
data_engineer.knowledge: ETL/ELT Pipelines, SQL, Spark/Dask, Data warehousing

effects.summary: Data processing is infrastructure-heavy. Focus on scalability, reliability, and monitoring from the start.

lead_architect.title: Lead AI Architect
lead_architect.knowledge: Multi-agent systems, LLM orchestration, Safety mechanisms

research_engineer.title: Research Engineer
research_engineer.knowledge: LLM Frameworks (LangChain, LlamaIndex), API Tooling, Autonomous Systems, Safety research

effects.summary: CAUTION: Agentic AI is experimental technology. Approach as research project with no production guarantees.
warnings: EXPERIMENTAL RISK: Agentic systems are unpredictable and represent frontier research
NO PRODUCTION GUARANTEES: This technology is not ready for mission-critical applications
SAFETY CONCERNS: Autonomous agents can take unexpected actions

feasibility.summary: Technology is in research phase. Production readiness uncertain.

researchQuestions: Can the task be decomposed into reliable sub-tasks?
How will you handle unpredictable behavior?

questions.text: What is the scope of this project?

effects.summary: PoC focuses on technical feasibility validation. Expect rough edges and manual processes.

warnings: MVP requires production-grade engineering practices and basic MLOps

ml_ops.title: MLOps Engineer
ml_ops.knowledge: CI/CD, Docker, Cloud Services, Model deployment

warnings: Production scope requires enterprise-grade architecture, full MLOps, and ongoing maintenance planning
Timeline and budget increase significantly for production requirements

questions.text: What type of data do you have?

techProfile.DataProcessing: Standard SQL and pandas/polars workflows apply
Text preprocessing and NLP pipelines required
Image preprocessing and augmentation pipelines required

warnings: Video processing is computationally expensive and requires specialized infrastructure
Storage and compute costs can be prohibitive for large video datasets
Audio processing requires specialized models and significant computational resources

techProfile.SpecializedTools: Audio processing libraries (librosa, speechrecognition) or API services

iot_engineer.title: IoT Data Engineer
iot_engineer.knowledge: Streaming protocols, Time-series databases, Edge computing

warnings: Multi-modal data significantly increases architectural complexity
CRITICAL BLOCKER: No data means no AI project. Data acquisition is the mandatory first step.
Budget and timeline must account for data collection, labeling, and quality assurance

feasibility.summary: Project cannot proceed without addressing data acquisition first

data_strategist.title: Data Strategy Consultant
data_strategist.knowledge: Data acquisition, Partnership negotiations, Synthetic data

warnings: CRITICAL LIMITATION: Dataset is too small for robust deep learning models
Statistical significance of results may be questionable
avoidTech: Training deep learning models from scratch

techProfile.RecommendedApproach: Transfer learning, pre-trained models, or simple classical ML

effects.validationStrategy: Leave-one-out or bootstrap validation due to small sample size

techProfile.RecommendedTools: Pandas, Scikit-learn, XGBoost suitable for this scale

optimizations: Incremental learning for larger end of range

techProfile.DataProcessing: Spark, Polars, Dask, or chunked processing recommended
techProfile.ModelTraining: Consider distributed training for deep learning

options.label: Very Large (e.g., millions of records or > 500 GB)

techProfile.Infrastructure: Cloud data platforms (Databricks, Snowflake, BigQuery) recommended

data_engineer.title: Senior Data Engineer
data_engineer.knowledge: Spark/Dask, Distributed Systems, Cloud Data Warehouses, Performance optimization

data_architect.title: Data Architect
data_architect.knowledge: Data lake architecture, Partitioning strategies, Cost optimization

techProfile.DataProcessing: Stream processing platforms (Kafka, Flink, Kinesis) required
techProfile.Architecture: Event-driven architecture with real-time ML inference

streaming_engineer.title: Streaming Data Engineer
streaming_engineer.knowledge: Kafka, Flink, Stream processing patterns, Real-time ML

questions.text: How frequently is new data generated or updated?

techProfile.Architecture: Streaming architecture with online learning capabilities
Batch processing with daily model retraining pipeline

warnings: Model drift risk: Performance will degrade over time as real-world conditions change
Plan for eventual model updates even with static training data

questions.text: Does the data contain sensitive or regulated information (PII, PHI, etc.)?

warnings: SECURITY CRITICAL: Sensitive data requires comprehensive privacy and security protocols
Legal and compliance teams must be involved from project inception

security_specialist.title: Security & Compliance Specialist
security_specialist.knowledge: Data privacy regulations, Anonymization techniques, Security auditing

securityRequirements: Data encryption at rest and in transit

warnings: Data sensitivity audit required before proceeding

questions.text: What level of accuracy or performance is required?

avoidTech: Complex 'black box' models unless absolutely necessary
Generative AI, Large neural networks if simpler interpretable models suffice
warnings: EXTREME REQUIREMENTS: >99% accuracy dramatically increases complexity and may not be achievable
Consider if business truly requires this level or if it's aspirational
effects.riskAssessment: Many domains where >99% accuracy is not technically feasible with current technology

options.label: Moderate (e.g., >85%, internal tool to assist users)

advantages: Focus on user experience and iteration
effects.approach: Build iteratively, gather user feedback, improve over time

options.label: Better than the current baseline/human performance

effects.validationStrategy: A/B testing against current baseline is critical

options.label: Critical (for regulatory compliance or user trust)

avoidTech: Complex 'black box' models unless absolutely necessary
Generative AI, Large neural networks if simpler interpretable models suffice

techProfile.ModelChoice: Prefer interpretable models (Linear/Logistic Regression, Decision Trees, Rule-based systems)

xai_specialist.title: Explainable AI Specialist
xai_specialist.knowledge: SHAP, LIME, Interpretable ML, Model documentation

techProfile.XAI: Basic explainability tools for model debugging and validation

effects.modelDevelopment: Include explainability analysis in development workflow
effects.debugging: Feature importance analysis, model inspection tools

options.label: Not a priority ("Black Box" is acceptable)

questions.text: Are there multi-lingual or multi-regional requirements?

effects.futureConsiderations: Plan for potential expansion to other languages/regions

warnings: Multi-lingual support significantly increases data sourcing complexity
Model performance may vary significantly across languages

techProfile.ModelType: Multi-lingual models (XLM-R, mBERT) or language-specific models
techProfile.DataRequirements: Balanced datasets across all target languages

effects.validationStrategy: Language-specific validation sets and native speaker evaluation

warnings: Multi-regional requirements require cultural bias analysis
Regional regulations may vary significantly

cultural_consultant.title: Cultural/Regional Consultant
cultural_consultant.knowledge: Regional cultural norms, Local regulations, Market differences

questions.text: What are the operational uptime requirements (SLA)?

techProfile.InfrastructureNeeds: Multi-region deployment, Load balancing, Automated failover

sre_engineer.title: Site Reliability Engineer
sre_engineer.knowledge: Kubernetes, Service mesh, Monitoring, Incident response

warnings: High availability requirements significantly increase infrastructure complexity and costs
Requires 24/7 on-call support and incident response procedures

questions.text: What is the primary business Key Performance Indicator (KPI) this project is intended to improve?

effects.validationStrategy: A/B testing with revenue impact measurement

effects.roiCalculation: Direct cost savings vs. implementation costs

effects.validationStrategy: Historical data validation and expert review

warnings: BUSINESS RISK: Project lacks clear business objectives
Without defined KPIs, success measurement is impossible
High risk of scope creep and unclear deliverables
recommendedApproach: Define success criteria before technical work
Limit initial scope to feasibility assessment

warnings: BUDGET CONSTRAINT: Very limited budget restricts scope to basic PoC or feasibility study
No production deployment possible within this budget
CRITICAL PLANNING GAP: Budget definition is essential for proper project scoping
Cannot provide realistic timeline or resource estimates without budget constraints
requiredActions: Develop budget range based on business objectives

questions.text: Do you have AI/ML expertise in your team?

effects.collaboration: Partner with existing team, provide specialized expertise

sr_ai_consultant.title: Senior AI Consultant
sr_ai_consultant.knowledge: AI/ML strategy, Team mentorship, Best practices training

warnings: HIGH RISK: No internal expertise creates dependency and maintenance challenges
Knowledge transfer and handover planning is critical
Long-term maintenance strategy must be defined upfront

lead_ml_engineer.title: Lead ML Engineer
lead_ml_engineer.knowledge: Full-stack ML development, MLOps, Production deployment

questions.text: How will the system be maintained after deployment?

options.label: The client has a dedicated MLOps team

effects.collaboration: Work closely with MLOps team during development

options.label: Requires a long-term retainer contract for our firm to maintain

warnings: Long-term maintenance contracts must be scoped and budgeted as separate phase
Define clear SLAs and response times for maintenance activities

options.label: The model will be static and rarely updated

warnings: PERFORMANCE DEGRADATION RISK: Model performance will degrade over time due to data drift
Plan for eventual retraining even if infrequent

options.label: The system must be designed for automated retraining

techProfile.MLOps: Automated retraining pipelines (Kubeflow, Vertex AI Pipelines, MLflow) required
techProfile.Monitoring: Comprehensive model and data drift detection

mlops_engineer.title: MLOps Engineer
mlops_engineer.knowledge: Pipeline orchestration, Model versioning, Automated testing

warnings: CRITICAL PLANNING GAP: Maintenance strategy is essential for long-term success
Maintenance costs often exceed initial development costs

questions.text: What happens if the AI system makes a significant error?

options.label: Catastrophic consequences (e.g., safety, legal, major financial loss)

warnings: MISSION-CRITICAL SYSTEM: Catastrophic error consequences require extreme validation measures
Consider if AI automation is appropriate or if human oversight is mandatory
Regulatory approval may be required

feasibility.summary: High-stakes systems require extensive validation that may not be technically or economically feasible

safety_engineer.title: Safety Systems Engineer
safety_engineer.knowledge: Safety-critical systems, Formal verification, Risk analysis

regulatory_specialist.title: Regulatory Affairs Specialist
regulatory_specialist.knowledge: Industry regulations, Compliance frameworks, Approval processes

options.label: Significant business impact (e.g., customer churn, moderate financial loss)
Moderate impact, manageable (e.g., internal workflow disruption)

effects.approach: Standard ML practices with reasonable validation

questions.text: Is it more important to avoid False Positives or False Negatives?

options.label: False Negatives are worse (e.g., missing a disease, a critical threat)

techProfile.ModelTuning: Optimize for High Recall. Accept higher false alarm rate to minimize missed cases.
techProfile.ThresholdStrategy: Lower decision thresholds to catch more positive cases

businessTradeoffs: Higher operational costs from false alarms

options.label: False Positives are worse (e.g., wrongly accusing a customer of fraud)

techProfile.ModelTuning: Optimize for High Precision. Model must be very confident before making positive predictions.
techProfile.ThresholdStrategy: Higher decision thresholds to ensure confidence in positive predictions

techProfile.ModelTuning: Optimize for balanced F1-score or overall accuracy

effects.considerations: May want to revisit this based on business impact analysis

questions.text: Are there strict regulatory or compliance requirements (e.g., GDPR, HIPAA, financial auditing)?

warnings: COMPLIANCE CRITICAL: Strict regulations significantly impact technology choices and timeline
Legal and compliance teams MUST be involved from project inception
Audit trails and documentation requirements are extensive

compliance_specialist.title: Compliance Specialist
compliance_specialist.knowledge: Industry regulations, Audit requirements, Documentation standards

legal_counsel.title: Legal Counsel
legal_counsel.knowledge: Regulatory landscape, Risk assessment, Liability implications

techProfile.Explainability: Likely mandatory for audit and compliance
techProfile.Auditing: Complete audit trail of all model decisions and data processing
techProfile.Documentation: Extensive documentation of model development and validation

options.label: No specific regulations beyond standard practice

techProfile.Explainability: MANDATORY: Use SHAP or LIME. Strongly prefer interpretable models (Linear/Logistic Regression, Decision Trees).
techProfile.ModelComplexity: Avoid deep learning unless interpretability can be maintained

techProfile.Strategy: MANDATORY Human-in-the-Loop (HITL) validation before any automated action. System should augment, not replace, human experts.
techProfile.Validation: Formal verification methods and extensive testing required

warnings: A formal Model Risk Management framework must be implemented

feasibility.summary: Catastrophic error consequences may make AI automation inadvisable

warnings: CRITICAL BUDGET MISMATCH: Budget is completely insufficient for MVP or Production scope
RECOMMENDATION: Re-scope to PoC or increase budget by 3-10x

feasibility.summary: Project scope and budget are fundamentally misaligned. Not viable as stated.

alternatives: Phase the project over multiple budget cycles

warnings: RISK: Budget may be insufficient for production system with no internal expertise
Consider MVP scope or increased budget for comprehensive handover
CRITICAL EXPERTISE MISMATCH: No internal AI expertise but expecting complex maintenance
This combination is not feasible without significant training or hiring

techProfile.Strategy: Transfer Learning / Fine-tuning pre-trained models is the ONLY viable approach
techProfile.DataAugmentation: Aggressive data augmentation and synthetic data generation required

warnings: CRITICAL DATA LIMITATION: Dataset too small for training from scratch
Success entirely depends on finding suitable pre-trained models
avoidTech: Training new model architectures from scratch

feasibility.summary: Limited data severely constrains approach options

warnings: CRITICAL PRIVACY RISK: Using PII with Generative AI poses extreme privacy and legal risks
Data anonymization/pseudonymization MANDATORY before any LLM interaction
Third-party model APIs may retain sensitive data
avoidTech: Sending raw PII to third-party model APIs
requiredMeasures: Legal review of all data flows

warnings: CRITICAL COMPLIANCE RISK: Generative AI in regulated environments requires extensive controls
Hallucinations and unpredictable outputs pose major compliance threats
May require regulatory approval before deployment

ai_ethics_advisor.title: AI Ethics & Legal Advisor
ai_ethics_advisor.knowledge: AI governance, Ethical AI, Regulatory compliance

warnings: EXTREME RISK COMBINATION: Agentic AI with high error impact is not recommended
Autonomous systems cannot be trusted in high-stakes environments with current technology

feasibility.summary: This combination represents unacceptable risk levels

warnings: IMPOSSIBLE REQUIREMENTS: Extreme accuracy (>99%) with limited data is typically not achievable
Reconsider if this accuracy level is truly necessary
BUDGET MISMATCH: High availability requirements cannot be met with limited budget
HA infrastructure typically costs $100k+ annually
EXPERTISE GAP: Streaming data requires specialized expertise not available internally
Streaming systems are significantly more complex than batch processing

streaming_architect.title: Streaming Data Architect
streaming_architect.knowledge: Streaming platforms, Real-time processing, Event-driven architecture

warnings: SCOPE-BUDGET MISMATCH: Multi-lingual support requires significantly more resources
Each additional language typically adds 50-100% to development effort
